emp_rate.long_description: Population self-reported as employed as a percentage of total civilian workforce population. Based on American Community Survey Table 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
emp_rate.short_description: Population self-reported as employed as a percentage of total civilian workforce population.

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: 5-Year estimates, table B23025, via the API

emp_rate.statement: {value} of the population in {region_name} is employed.

job_participate_rate.long_description: The percentage of individuals 16-64 years of age in the active labor force. The job particpation rate is often used by economists as an indicator of economic development and growth.
job_participate_rate.short_description: The percentage of individuals 16-64 years of age in the active labor force.

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: 5-Year estimates, table B23025, via the API

job_participate_rate.statement: {value} of the population in {region_name} is participating in the civilian job force.
